authentication.notes: COMPLETELY FREE! Open source platform. Self-host or use community instances. No license fees or registration required for core platform.

description: MISP - FREE, open source threat intelligence platform for gathering, sharing, storing and correlating Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) of targeted attacks, threat intelligence, financial fraud information, vulnerability information or counter-terrorism information.

bash.misp_setup:
#!/bin/bash
# MISP Setup - FREE!

echo "[*] MISP Setup (COMPLETELY FREE!)"
echo "=================================="
echo ""

echo "[+] Docker Installation:"
echo "    docker pull coolacid/misp-docker"
echo "    docker run -d -p 443:443 coolacid/misp-docker"
echo ""

echo "[+] Ubuntu Installation:"
echo "    wget -O /tmp/INSTALL.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MISP/MISP/2.4/INSTALL/INSTALL.sh"
echo "    bash /tmp/INSTALL.sh"
echo ""

echo "[+] Access MISP:"
echo "    URL: https://localhost"
echo "    Default: admin@admin.test / admin"
echo ""

echo "[+] Key Features:"
echo "    - IOC Management"
echo "    - Threat Intelligence Sharing"
echo "    - Feed Aggregation"
echo "    - Correlation Engine"
echo "    - Galaxy Clusters"
echo "    - Export Formats (STIX, OpenIOC, etc.)"
echo ""

echo "[+] Resources:"
echo "    - Website: https://www.misp-project.org/"
echo "    - GitHub: https://github.com/MISP/MISP"
echo "    - Documentation: https://www.misp-project.org/documentation/"
echo ""

echo "[!] 100% FREE - No license required!"

curl.create_event:
# Create MISP event - FREE!
curl -X POST https://localhost/events/add \
  -H 'Authorization: YOUR_API_KEY' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{"Event": {"info": "Test Event", "distribution": 2, "threat_level_id": 1}}'

python.pymisp_client:
from pymisp import PyMISP, MISPEvent, MISPAttribute
import json
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Dict, List

class MISPClient:
    """MISP Platform Client - COMPLETELY FREE!"""
    
    def __init__(self, url='https://localhost', key='YOUR_API_KEY'):
        # Note: For demo purposes only
        self.url = url
        self.key = key
        # self.misp = PyMISP(url, key, False)
        
    def create_event_example(self):
        """Create threat event (FREE!)"""
        print("== MISP Event Creation (FREE!)\n")
        
        event = {
            'info': 'Ransomware Campaign - LockBit 3.0',
            'distribution': 2,  # Organization only
            'threat_level': 1,  # High
            'analysis': 2,  # Completed
            'tags': [
                'ransomware:lockbit',
                'tlp:amber',
                'mitre-attack:impact'
            ]
        }
        
        print("Event details:")
        for key, value in event.items():
            print(f"  {key}: {value}")
        
        return event
    
    def add_iocs_example(self):
        """Add IOCs to event (FREE!)"""
        print("== Adding IOCs (FREE!)\n")
        
        iocs = [
            {'type': 'ip-dst', 'value': '192.168.1.100', 'category': 'Network activity'},
            {'type': 'domain', 'value': 'malicious.example.com', 'category': 'Network activity'},
            {'type': 'md5', 'value': 'd41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e', 'category': 'Payload delivery'},
            {'type': 'email-src', 'value': 'phishing@badactor.com', 'category': 'Payload delivery'},
            {'type': 'url', 'value': 'http://malware.download/payload.exe', 'category': 'Payload delivery'},
            {'type': 'yara', 'value': 'rule detect_ransomware { strings: $a = "LOCKBIT" condition: $a }', 'category': 'Payload installation'}
        ]
        
        print("IOCs to add:")
        for ioc in iocs:
            print(f"  [{ioc['type']}] {ioc['value'][:50]}..." if len(ioc['value']) > 50 else f"  [{ioc['type']}] {ioc['value']}")
        
        return iocs
    
    def search_events_example(self):
        """Search threat events (FREE!)"""
        print("== Searching Events (FREE!)\n")
        
        searches = [
            {'tags': 'ransomware'},
            {'type_attribute': 'ip-src'},
            {'from': '2024-01-01'},
            {'threat_level': '1'},  # High
            {'published': True}
        ]
        
        print("Search filters:")
        for search in searches:
            for key, value in search.items():
                print(f"  {key}: {value}")
        
        return searches
    
    def galaxy_clusters_example(self):
        """Galaxy clusters example (FREE!)"""
        print("== MISP Galaxy Clusters (FREE!)\n")
        
        galaxies = {
            'Threat Actor': ['APT28', 'APT29', 'Lazarus Group', 'FIN7'],
            'Malware': ['Emotet', 'TrickBot', 'Cobalt Strike', 'Mimikatz'],
            'Attack Pattern': ['Spearphishing', 'Supply Chain Attack', 'Living off the Land'],
            'Tool': ['PowerShell Empire', 'BloodHound', 'Responder', 'CrackMapExec']
        }
        
        for galaxy_type, items in galaxies.items():
            print(f"[+] {galaxy_type}:")
            for item in items:
                print(f"    - {item}")
            print()
        
        return galaxies

name: MISP Project

operational_guidance.value_proposition: The de facto standard for threat intelligence sharing, completely free and open source with global community support
